options.name: -d
options.tip: Make a directory instead of a file

options.name: -u
options.tip: do not create anything; merely print a name (unsafe)

options.name: -q
options.tip: Fail silently if an error occurs.

options.name: --suffix
tip:
U: --suffix <SUFFIX>
append SUFFIX to TEMPLATE;
SUFFIX must not contain a path separator.
This option is implied if TEMPLATE does not end with X.

options.name: --tmpdir
tip:
U: --tmpdir[=<DIR>]
interpret TEMPLATE relative to DIR;
if DIR is not specified, use $TMPDIR ($TMP on windows) if set, else /tmp.
With this option, TEMPLATE must not be an absolute name; unlike with -t, TEMPLATE may contain slashes, but mktemp creates only the final component

description: Create a temporary file or directory.
